title: Cardano BI - Native languages
description: The Cardano BI solution currently supports English. To support more languages we must add some functionality and get help from translators

f6_assessments.q0: This is a good proposal to translate an existing knowledge base into other languages. Whilst it mentions a few languages as examples, there is no clear plan for exactly which languages will be supported.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposers already have a successful knowledge base and wish to have support for other languages included. What is missing is a clear plan for which languages will be supported, thus is is hard to know if the funds requested are appropriate, and to know what they actually intend to deliver.  How many word is the current knowledge base? What does the budget work out as in $/word/language?
If your site is currently only in English, how are you going to market to bring non-English users onboard? Or do you have a large number of users from non-English speaking backgrounds already that would benefit from documents in their own languages? If so do you have numbers on that?
f6_assessments.q2:
Whilst conversion of an existing knowledge base into other languages is a simple goal, this plan lack a clear direction for what languages will be supported. At one point Japanese character support is listed, then later Chinese, Arabic and Spanish are discussed. Are all 4 being provided? This makes it very hard to audit progress.
What would be success? It might be an idea to track views of the translated documents to see how much it is being used.

f6_assessments.q0:
the idea within its scope is good and well presented. Having as much site as possibles in multiple languages would help to reach people who dont speak english. However, I'm not sure on the reach of this specific website. It would be good to have some access figures (totals, by country, etc) just to give an idea on the potential of the impact of this specific proposal (potential audience) - specially for those who dont know the site well.
If the the method used in the development of this idea presents itself good, it would also be nice to have it well documented and explained to be used in other similar websites (by method here I mean the way the languages will be chosen and the process which how data translatation will be done - will be there a review by others to ensure quality?). Also, not sure if voting which langues it should be translated would be the best way to solely pick the translations. Countries who never heard of this website because its only has a few english speakers will keep with no voice. Maybe the voting system could be combined with  other methods (population size, number of transactions, Cardano expansion strategy and so on)
f6_assessments.q1:
The CENT team who already owns the site should have enough resource/capability to do the site remodeling but its not clear if the translators will be part of the team or just provide the translation as "freelancers". Also, not clear if they'll get pay for the translation or not. 

regarding the plan, there are final deliverables after 3 months but not spread through the weeks. Maybe having a MVP and sprints to test and get quick feedback from limited users on the site changes  before final deadline (3rd month) would help. There's a total budget but its not broken down so its noteasy to check if its reasonable. How much time from the team each deliverable will require? how many resources will be available? do translators get pay and if so how much?
f6_assessments.q2:
There are final deliverables but no kpis or intermediate milestones during project development.   It would be nice to have it listed in the proposal how many languages they expect to have the site translated after some periods of time after approval, how many translator engaged and how this changes in the website and translators are helping the traffic on the site to grow to non-english speakers.

risks and challenges related to translation quality, communication to non english speakers were not considered.

f6_assessments.q0: Translating a Cardano resource to other major languages besides English falls right within the category of the challenge. And this is a must-do more so in the Alonzo era when we expect many more new users will be introduced to Cardano and many more projects will arise, all needing access to data and information.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer seems to have the right credentials to see this project through to success given bi.stakepoolcentral.com is live in production. There is a high level of confidence that the requirements to enhance the site to accomodate additional languages would be far less complex than what's completed to actually build the site. The proposer also mentioned current support for Japanese Kanji characters and this demonstrates experience in the process already.
f6_assessments.q2:
Despite the proposer's experience and expertise, this only rated a score of 3-stars in the audibility department since an itemised plan has not been presented. It would be beneficial to the voting members of Catalyst to see each step of the dev pathway, how long parts of the website enhancements will take and the budget for each step and resource utilised. In order to be completely auditable, there is an expectation from the voting members to see how the requested funds will be spent and on what. 
Will the $13000 requested be solely spent on site enhancements? Will translators be paid? How much of the amount is allocated to the mechanism for submitting a language? These are the kinds of information needed in the proposal to secure a higher rating for audibility.

f6_assessments.q0: Although this proposal is about multilingual support (which is the focus of the challenge), it is a fairly narrow proposal rather than one that would provide broad benefits to the Cardano community. It relates only to multilingual support for the interface of a Cardano data site that provides information which is also readily available elsewhere. It also appears that the proposal may be mainly to allow alternate character sets to be displayed rather than providing translated documentation in multiple languages (this should be clearer). It is also not clear what it would mean for users to set their preferred site language -- what information would be displayed in that language? Some of the proposed functions also seem of limited use: notably it does not seem necessary to build a voting mechanism for users to choose new languages -- this could be done by a simple poll. For these reasons, I neither agree nor disagree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal presents a translation plan, but no information on how the plan would be implemented or on who has the skill set to do so (e.g. where translators would be found). There is no detail regarding what activities would be funded by the proposed budget. Also, the scope of the translation activities are unclear as explained under the first criterion above, which compounds the issues with implementation. On the positive side, the proposer shows that it has development experience and some experience with languages. Overall, I disagree but do not strongly disagree that there is evidence that it is highly likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: The scope of the proposal is unclear (see first criterion above) and there are no KPIs or success metrics provided. Accordingly, I strongly disagree that the information provided is sufficient to audit the progress and success of the proposal.
f6_assessments.reply: The proposal is critizized for not having a clear plan for implementing and who shall do the development. We have clearly stated that we will do the development of the functionality and we will ask for translation assistance from the Community. Cannot see why there should be any concern about IF this solution can be developed. We only ask for funding to expand our already running product. We have also seen in comparable cases for other solutions that the Cardano community gladly helps out when asked to help with transation to their native language. Proposal is also critizized for not having a clear scope and time for delivery. We have clearly stated what will be developed and that this will be delivered within 3 months

f6_assessments.q0: The problem stated is valid and the move towards multi-languages would be one way to add value to the Cardano community. To attract votes it would be good to spell out the purpose of the site. Why is it important? why are people using it? These questions are understood by technically minded users but may not be by all voters. The flow on effect being once proposal objectives are clear to voters the need to expand to multi-languages also becomes clear to the voting public.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer appears to have good experience in blockchain technology based on the website already up and running so it is highly likely given funding the proposal will be implemented. The plan could further highlight how translators would be sourced. I do wonder if the team have reached out to the Cardano community to source potential translaters. This I feel would have added value to this proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: I do feel that this is a worthwhile project but feel it is lacking in terms of a budget breakdown, and a plan stating how the search for translators will progress. I realise that voting on languages is yet to be held but feel pick a language and show the community how that looks and then progress to voting for further languages.

f6_assessments.q0: This was a good proposal, it had some great ideas, reasoning behind them. A voting system for the languages was a perfect idea. They explain their budget in short details. This proposal did lack a plan, how are they going to complete this voting system, who will be involved, how will people know about it. They also didn't include a timeline of events and milestones which should be something to add next time.
f6_assessments.q1: Without a big plan or timeline it is hard implement something successfully. The proposer does have 20 years of  experience as a developer which is great. Overall, it was a splendid idea but the proposal needs a little bit of extra work.
f6_assessments.q2: The half explained budget is great but they lacked a timeline explaining their milestones or goals. That makes it hard to audit the success towards their goal of getting Cardano to have more translations.

solution: We want to rebuild our site to support non-english languages and let the community vote which languages to support
experience: University degree software engineer, 20 years experience as dev. and solution architect. Developer of site https://bi.stakepoolcentral.com
